    • Field Detail

      • br

        private java.io.BufferedReader br
        The reader used to read the incoming commands.

      • player

        private final NetworkPlayer player
        Reference to the associated player.

      • server

        private final Server server
        Reference to the Server object.

      • game

        private HostedGame game
        If the associated player is in-game then this is a reference to the game the player is involved in.

      • dos

        private int dos
        Denial of Service (DoS) counter. Keeps track of the amount of requests the client has send in a short amount of time. If the amount exceeds a certain threshold the client is given a denial of service, in this case the server will not listen to it anymore. Every so often the value is decremented such that the denial of service is only given if the client makes many requests in a short amount of time.

      • DOS_THRESHOLD

        private static final int DOS_THRESHOLD
        If this threshold is reached the player will be banned for sending too many requests in a short amount of time.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DOS_DECREMENT_INTERVAL

        private static final int DOS_DECREMENT_INTERVAL
        The Denial of Service counter is decremented every this amount of milliseconds. A client should not send requests faster than this rate or it might get banned from the server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isCloseRequested

        private boolean isCloseRequested
        If this variable is set to true then the run() method will break from the while-loop in the next iteration. Consequently, the InputHandler thread finishes and the server will no longer listen to the associated client.

      • EXCEPTION_SOURCE_NAME

        private static final java.lang.String EXCEPTION_SOURCE_NAME
        Indicates where the command was sent from. Used in exception messages.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputHandler

        public InputHandler(NetworkPlayer player,
                    java.net.Socket sock,
                    Server server)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Construct a player's input handler, which listens to commands send from the client to the server.
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose input handler this is
        sock - the socket through which the player is connected
        server - reference to the server the player is connected to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input reader could not be opened

    • Method Detail

      • setGame

        public void setGame(HostedGame game)
        Sets the HostedGame reference of the input handler.
        Parameters:
        game - the game the associated player is involved in

      • updateRequests

        private void updateRequests(int val)
        Adds a certain value to the DoS counter.
        Parameters:
        val - the DoS counter is increased with this value. Supposed to be positive, with an exception for the DoS decrementer thread.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close this input handler. The server will no longer listen to the associated client.

      • run

        public void run()
        Listens for commands from the client.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String input)
           throws CommandFormatException
        Parses the command and acts according to that command.
        Parameters:
        input - the full received command
        Throws:
        CommandFormatException - if the command's keyword is invalid and/or its arguments
